title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 25 May 2009 - XWiki
content:

lucaa left #xwiki at 10:11  
asyd - (25/05/2009 10:12): hello there  
KermitTheFragger joined #xwiki at 10:14  
anamarias joined #xwiki at 10:22  
CristinaS left at 10:26 (Read error: 110 (Connection timed out))  
vmassol - (25/05/2009 10:36): lo  
asyd - (25/05/2009 10:37): hello vmassol   
vmassol - (25/05/2009 10:37): asyd: no I don't use jmeter... have used it once or twice in the past a long time ago.. but for simple things  
vmassol - (25/05/2009 10:38): (before you ask ;))  
asyd - (25/05/2009 10:38): :)  
asyd - (25/05/2009 10:38): hey, I post a simple scenario :P  
arunreddy joined #xwiki at 10:38  
vmassol - (25/05/2009 10:38): yep seen the jira issue that's cool  
cypromis joined #xwiki at 10:39  
asyd - (25/05/2009 10:39): but that didn't work with multiples threads...   
vmassol - (25/05/2009 10:39): I'd like to setup some semi automated perf testing for xwiki but I'd need time for this... so this is open to anyone interested and haviong the time  
vmassol - (25/05/2009 10:39): asyd: ah not very interesting then :)  
asyd - (25/05/2009 10:39): yeah  
asyd - (25/05/2009 10:39): I guess it's a jmeter bug  
asyd - (25/05/2009 10:39): a variable computed by: BLOG-${\_\_time()} have the same value in each tread  
asyd - (25/05/2009 10:40): while time include the milliseconds, thats sounds strange  
asyd - (25/05/2009 10:40): (that make impossible to create multiple posts, since there are the same name)  
tuska left at 10:43 ("Ex-Chat")

sdumitriu - (25/05/2009 12:04): news  
anamarias joined #xwiki at 12:11  
kaaloo left at 12:28 (Remote closed the connection)  
kaaloo joined #xwiki at 12:29  
ChathuraPrabuddh joined #xwiki at 13:10  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 13:32  
lucaa left #xwiki at 13:32  
vmassol left at 13:47 (Remote closed the connection)  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 13:47  
arkub joined #xwiki at 14:01  
arkub left at 14:20 (Read error: 113 (No route to host))  
sdumitriu - (25/05/2009 14:20): ChathuraPrabuddh: Hi  
arkub joined #xwiki at 14:21  
asyd - (25/05/2009 14:35): fyi: Deploying application in domain failed; Error loading deployment descriptors for module [xwiki] Line 76 Column 17 -- Deployment descriptor file WEB-INF/web.xml in archive [xwiki]. Element type "dispatcher" must be declared.  
asyd - (25/05/2009 14:36): when trying to deploy the last milestone (1.9-m2-) in glassfish 2.1  
sdumitriu - (25/05/2009 14:37): Yes, that's a problem  
sdumitriu - (25/05/2009 14:37): That's a servlets 2.4 feature  
asyd - (25/05/2009 14:38): hmm  
asyd - (25/05/2009 14:39): so is there something to do? like create a sun-web.xml maybe?  
sdumitriu - (25/05/2009 14:39): Well, the DTD must be updated  
asyd - (25/05/2009 14:40): ok  
sdumitriu - (25/05/2009 14:42): Seems that 2.4 does not have a DTD anymore  
sdumitriu - (25/05/2009 14:42): It uses xml schemas  
sdumitriu - (25/05/2009 14:42): You can try to delete the DTD declaration completely  
cristinaS joined #xwiki at 14:46  
ChathuraPrabuddh - (25/05/2009 14:47): sdumitriu:hai  
sdumitriu - (25/05/2009 14:48): Hi ChathuraPrabuddh  
sdumitriu - (25/05/2009 14:48): You should create a new account on www.xwiki.org  
sdumitriu - (25/05/2009 14:48): With a simple name, all lowercase  
ChathuraPrabuddh - (25/05/2009 14:48): ok:)  
ChathuraPrabuddh - (25/05/2009 14:52): sdumitriu:I have an account, which I had created earlier.So do I have to create a another one.  
sdumitriu - (25/05/2009 14:53): What is it called?  
ChathuraPrabuddh - (25/05/2009 14:54): Chathura Prabuddha  
sdumitriu - (25/05/2009 14:54): Well, you must create a new one  
ChathuraPrabuddh - (25/05/2009 14:55): ok  
ChathuraPrabuddh - (25/05/2009 15:00): sdumitriu:done  
ChathuraPrabuddh - (25/05/2009 15:00): done  
sdumitriu - (25/05/2009 15:03): Now you have commit access to the sandbox  
sdumitriu - (25/05/2009 15:03): svn co https://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/sandbox/gsoc/survey/  
sdumitriu - (25/05/2009 15:03): This is where you will put the code  
ChathuraPrabuddh - (25/05/2009 15:05): Sddumitriu:I'm doing the document type manager proj. Is it ok to put the code there  
alexxed joined #xwiki at 15:06  
maploin joined #xwiki at 15:07  
anamarias - (25/05/2009 15:07): i have some trouble with posing a post on the blog  
sdumitriu - (25/05/2009 15:07): What's the problem?  
anamarias - (25/05/2009 15:08): http://gsoc.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Google+Gadget+and+OpenSocial+Integration/ does the text look light grey to you ?   
sdumitriu - (25/05/2009 15:08): No  
anamarias - (25/05/2009 15:08): when i go to the post page, it says it's not published also  
sdumitriu - (25/05/2009 15:08): I don't see it at all  
sdumitriu - (25/05/2009 15:08): That's normal  
anamarias - (25/05/2009 15:08): but i clicked publish severeal times  
sdumitriu - (25/05/2009 15:08): Oh, let me check something  
sdumitriu - (25/05/2009 15:09): Refresh  
anamarias - (25/05/2009 15:10): thanks, now it worked  
anamarias - (25/05/2009 15:10): but when i edit the post, the text gets bad formatting  
anamarias - (25/05/2009 15:10): what should i use for XML code for example ?  
sdumitriu - (25/05/2009 15:10): I guess that's because you're using the old WYSIWYG editor  
anamarias - (25/05/2009 15:10): i saw there is a macro for code  
anamarias - (25/05/2009 15:11): but didn't work well  
sdumitriu - (25/05/2009 15:11): No, that macro is not working, the old editor is a complete mess  
anamarias - (25/05/2009 15:11): is there anything available except the WYSIWYG editor ?  
sdumitriu - (25/05/2009 15:12): Try to edit again  
anamarias - (25/05/2009 15:14): is this xwiki syntax ? it looks like it  
anamarias - (25/05/2009 15:14): but i don't see it saying that  
sdumitriu - (25/05/2009 15:15): Yes, that's the wiki syntax  
ChathuraPrabuddh - (25/05/2009 15:19): sdumitriu:Do I have to create a separate space for document type manager  
sdumitriu - (25/05/2009 15:19): No  
sdumitriu - (25/05/2009 15:20): But you can, if you want  
ChathuraPrabuddh - (25/05/2009 15:21): So is it ok to commit into https://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/sandbox/gsoc/survey/  
sdumitriu - (25/05/2009 15:22): Yes  
ChathuraPrabuddh - (25/05/2009 15:22): ok thanks.  
jvdrean - (25/05/2009 15:24): sdumitriu: ping skype  
sdumitriu - (25/05/2009 15:24): Yes, seen it  
jvelociter left at 15:26 ()  
tuska joined #xwiki at 15:45  
jvelociter joined #xwiki at 15:49  
xwikibot joined #xwiki at 16:10  
kaaloo - (25/05/2009 16:17): Hi the grails xwiki rendering plugin is working great now.  I'm about to publish a 0.1 release to the grails plugin repository.  
kaaloo - (25/05/2009 16:17): (Have to learn how to do it ! :) )  
jvelociter - (25/05/2009 16:22): great !  
jvelociter - (25/05/2009 16:22): (kaaloo )  
jvelociter - (25/05/2009 16:22): so what does it do ?  
jvelociter - (25/05/2009 16:23): it makes the xwiki rendering available to grails apps ?  
jvelociter - (25/05/2009 16:26): does it work in the app engine ?  
jvelociter - (25/05/2009 16:26): that would be very nice  
jvelociter - (25/05/2009 16:26): and good publicity  
kaaloo - (25/05/2009 16:28): For the moment it just defines a g:xwikiRender tag that can be used in gsp pages  
jvelociter - (25/05/2009 16:28): ok  
jvelociter - (25/05/2009 16:28): and macros are supported as well ?  
jvelociter - (25/05/2009 16:28): in the xiwkiRender?   
kaaloo - (25/05/2009 16:29): I don't know about the app engine, the dependencies are here http://bazaar.launchpad.net/~kaaloo/%2Bjunk/grails-xwiki-rendering/files/head%3A/lib/  
jvelociter - (25/05/2009 16:29): you can write groovy in a xwikiRender tag in a gsp ? :D  
jvelociter - (25/05/2009 16:29): cool  
kaaloo - (25/05/2009 16:29): I don't know if all of this will work in GAE  
jvelociter - (25/05/2009 16:29): I'll give it a try on GAE  
kaaloo - (25/05/2009 16:29): the TransformationManager is commented out for the moment  
jvelociter - (25/05/2009 16:29): I have a grails app running there already  
jvelociter - (25/05/2009 16:29): ah ok  
jvelociter - (25/05/2009 16:29): so it's just wiki syntax  
kaaloo - (25/05/2009 16:29): The embedded container couldn't find it !.?  
kaaloo - (25/05/2009 16:30): I need to look at that  
jvelociter - (25/05/2009 16:30): ok  
kaaloo - (25/05/2009 16:30): One thing I want to do is to add office rendering, and pdf rendering, but first things first  
jvelociter - (25/05/2009 16:30): yep  
jvelociter - (25/05/2009 16:30): that's a good step already  
jvelociter - (25/05/2009 16:30): you'll blog about it ?  
kaaloo - (25/05/2009 16:31): Oh probably, unless I get tied up looking at the macros issue ;)  
jvelociter - (25/05/2009 16:31): hehe  
kaaloo - (25/05/2009 16:44): jvelociter, would you mind trying the plugin from the zip file ?  
jvelociter - (25/05/2009 16:45): yes, no pb  
jvelociter - (25/05/2009 16:45): I can try that later tonight or tomorrow  
jvelociter - (25/05/2009 16:46): where is the zip ?  
jvelociter - (25/05/2009 16:46): I can try a GAE deploy as well  
kaaloo - (25/05/2009 16:46): ok, I'm thinking I need to at least validate the syntax parameter that you can pass to xwikiRender against available syntaxes  
kaaloo - (25/05/2009 16:47): http://bazaar.launchpad.net/%7Ekaaloo/%2Bjunk/grails-xwiki-rendering/download/head%3A/grailsxwikirendering-20090525142649-av2s54ykhusufil2-1/grails-xwiki-rendering-0.1.zip  
jvelociter - (25/05/2009 16:47): I can download a zip from the bazzar viewer ?  
jvelociter - (25/05/2009 16:47): ah ok  
jvelociter - (25/05/2009 16:47): thanks  
kaaloo - (25/05/2009 16:48): thank you !  I hope it works on gae  
jvelociter - (25/05/2009 16:48): it should normally I guess  
jvelociter - (25/05/2009 16:54): ludovic had all the (old) xwiki rendering working under GAE  
jvelociter - (25/05/2009 16:54): + some parts of the store as well  
jvelociter - (25/05/2009 16:55): ah no sorry  
jvelociter - (25/05/2009 16:55): the NEW rendering :)  
jvelociter - (25/05/2009 16:55): you can check it there http://xwiki1.appspot.com/  
jvelociter - (25/05/2009 16:56): except groovy which does not work  
jvelociter - (25/05/2009 16:57): which is odd since gae supports groovy :)  
jvelociter - (25/05/2009 16:57): it looks like a programming rights check issue

jk\_work - (25/05/2009 20:35): Hi, I'm on this page: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/IncludeInVelocity...   I'm wondering if there is a way to include just one section into another page?  
cypromis joined #xwiki at 20:56  
tuska left at 20:57 ("Ex-Chat")  
jvelociter - (25/05/2009 21:06): jk\_work: Hi  
jvelociter - (25/05/2009 21:06): it's not possible currently  
jvelociter - (25/05/2009 21:06): though, with the new rendering (syntax xwiki/2.0) it's not very hard to implement as a macro
